meanings.definition: The quality of being overly curious or inquisitive about others' affairs.
meanings.sent1: Her nosiness often led her to eavesdrop on conversations.
meanings.sent2: His nosiness made him ask too many personal questions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's nosiness about the new neighbor's dog was comical.
meanings.sent4: The nosiness of the gossip spread faster than wildfire in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The child's nosiness about the hidden treasure made the adventure more exciting.

meanings.definition: An intrusive or prying attitude or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The nosiness of the reporter made the celebrity uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't resist her nosiness and peeked through the keyhole.
meanings.sent3: His nosiness in trying to read her diary was met with a stern warning.
meanings.sent4: The nosiness of the detective helped solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The nosiness of the nosy neighbor was the talk of the town.
